author: marcus.johnson
text: Sprint 13 wrap-up: rate limiting (TC-891) shipped, error messages (TC-912) shipped, auth session management (TC-880) is in review but I'm not confident it's fully validated — we only got the Redis cluster Thursday afternoon so testing was rushed.

author: marcus.johnson
text: Also want to flag for retro: the production incident Wednesday night ate ~6-8 hours of my sprint capacity. The caching race condition investigation (TC-930) is started but not done. That was unplanned work that pushed out the auth testing.

author: james.liu
text: My sprint summary: timezone fix (TC-903) shipped, dashboard refactor (TC-885) merged. Also got the GraphQL prototype (TC-935) to a working state — basic analytics queries are 3x faster than REST. I think we should seriously consider it for Sprint 14.

author: tom.anderson
text: Redis provisioning (TC-920) done. CI pipeline fix (TC-890) done — it was my Docker compose change leaking into CI. Both wrapped up Thursday.

author: priya.patel
text: Dashboard mockups (TC-925) complete and reviewed. Option B was selected. Starting detailed specs next sprint. User research findings are incorporated.

author: sarah.kim
text: Good work everyone. For the retro, I want to discuss: (1) the incident response process — Marcus shouldn't be solo on-call during a sprint-critical week, (2) the Redis provisioning delay — why did it take until Thursday when it was identified week 1?

author: david.park
text: Sprint 13 was a tough one. Auth migration is the #1 company priority — I need to know if the sprint goal was actually met or just partially. Be honest in retro.

author: marcus.johnson
text: To be clear on the sprint goal: auth migration session management is in review but NOT fully validated. We need at least another day of testing with the Redis cluster under load before I'd call it production-ready. So technically the sprint goal was not met.

author: priya.patel
text: Happy Friday! Anyone up for drinks after retro? That new cocktail bar on Valencia opened this week.

author: james.liu
text: Count me in! Need to decompress after this sprint.

author: marcus.johnson
text: Postmortem for the Feb 5 analytics incident is published. Key takeaway: we need better test coverage for concurrent access patterns. The caching layer rewrite should be Sprint 14 priority.
